intro: Microcephala deserticola, commonly known as the desert microcephala, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through features such as reduced leaf surface area and deep root systems. Its small, compact growth form helps minimize water loss and exposure to extreme temperatures. Microcephala deserticola plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert flora and fauna.
